answers.answer: You might not be eating enough.Some people get tired after excersing with they first start. Try things a little slower. Like go for a 30 min slow walk and build up to doing more.I would recommend eating some carbs like rice cakes and drink a protien shake after your work outs to put back in what you burned in your muscles. There have been times that I get real nauseated after a leg workout. I just lay down and relax. then I drink a protien shake and have some rice cakes

question: I am 29 years old.  I weigh close to 200lbs.   I do have high blood pressure, but my doctor says I can exercise.  I ordered the Hip Hop Abs from off the television because it seemed like a great idea to tighten up my unsightly bulges and have fun at the same time.  I just started yesterday.  I did 30 minutes, but I had to take quite a few breaks because I kept getting dizzy and short of breath.   I rested up for a few minutes and continued on.Maybe an hour or so after exercising, I began to get really really sleepy.  Drunk sleepy.  I couldn't keep my eyes open.  I was pretty sluggish.  I went to bed, and I could not fall to sleep because I couldn't catch my breath.  My heart was palpitating.  I felt like I was about to stop breathing and die!!  I was pretty scared and upset.  I was able to sleep once I talked with my mom on the phone.This morning.  I decided I would walk up 80 stairs and walk down those stairs as well.  I got back to my desk, and that same sleepiness took over me.  I was weak and wobbly in my legs, too.  It's like I can't exercise without feeling like this.  Please help.  I really need to get this weight off me.  ANY SUGGESTIONS???
title: Extremely fatigued and nauseated after exercise
